definitions: To cause (something) to become thoroughly soaked with liquid so that no more can be absorbed.
To fill (something) with a large amount of something so that no more can be added.
To cause (a substance) to combine with, or dissolve in, the largest possible amount of another substance.
To expose (a photographic film or paper) to so much light that further exposure will not produce a darker image.
examples: The rain began to saturate the ground.
The market is beginning to saturate with similar products.
We need to saturate the solution with salt.
The photographer tried not to saturate the film.
